title: Golden Boy 2019 award: England trio Phil Foden, Jadon Sancho and Mason Mount in final 20
text:
England trio Phil Foden, Jadon Sancho and Mason Mount have all been included on FIFA's final 20-man shortlist for the 2019 Golden Boy award.

The governing body first released a 40-man long-list last month, including six Premier League youngsters, but now that has been cut in half to a final 20.

The list, made up of the best under-21 players from across the European leagues, also includes the likes of Barcelona's new superstar Ansu Fati, Atletico Madrid's £107m man Joao Felix and Manchester United transfer target Erling Haaland.

Mason Mount, who played in England's 6-0 win in Bulgaria, is on FIFA's Golden Boy shortlist

Manchester City and England Under-21s star Phil Foden also makes the cut in 20-man list

Borussia Dortmund star Jadon Sancho is in, too, as they battle it out for the 2019 award

Danyell Malen, Vinicius Jnr, Matthijs de Ligt and Everton's Moise Kean are four more, as a star-studded line-up was revealed on Tuesday.

Felix is the overwhelming favourite following his big-money move to La Liga in the summer, and the winner will be announced in Turin on December 16.

De Ligt, who is nominated again, picked up the award last year, before reaching the Champions League semi-final with Ajax and moving to Juventus in the summer.

GOLDEN BOY 2019 SHORTLIST Matthijs de Ligt (Juventus, Holland) Alphonso Davies (Bayern Munich, Canada) Gianluigi Donnarumma (Milan, Italy) Ansu Fati (Barcelona, Spain) Philip Foden (Man City, England) Matteo Guendozi (Arsenal, France) Erling Haland (RB Salzburg, Norway) Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen, Germany) Joao Felix (Atletico Madrid, Portugal) Dejan Joveljic (Eintracht Frankfurt, Serbia) Moise Kean (Everton, Italy) Kang-in Lee (Valencia, South Korea) Andrij Oleksijovyc (Valladolid, Ukraine) Danyell Malen (PSV Eindhoven, Netherlands) Mason Mount (Chelsea, England) Rodrygo (Real Madrid, Brazil) Jadon Sancho (Borussia Dortmund, England) Ferran Torres (Valencia, Spain) Vinicius Jr (Real Madrid, Brazil) Nicolò Zaniolo (Roma, Italy)
